function-module.name: BAPI_TSCPRCONNE_TRANSFER_CPR
function-module.description: Transfer CATS II Data by cProjects

tables.name: TRANSFER_RECORDS
tables.description: Transferred Data from CATS II for Feedback in cProjects

documentation.functionality: The business object TSCPRCONNE enables the Cross-Application Time Sheet (CATS II) to be connected to the cProjects application. Data is transferred to the target system using the IDOC interface. The connection to the IDOC interface is made using the BAPI method <LS>TransferCPR</>. This method calls function module <LS>BAPI_TSCPRCONNE_TRANSFER_CPR</> in the relevant target system.
documentation.hints: To set up the transfer of data from the Time Sheet (CATS II) with cProjects, you must make the necessary settings in the <DS:GLOS.352A41BED9685CD5E10000009B38F974>ALE Distribution Model</>.

table.name: BAPI_TSCPRCONNE_TRANSFER
table.description: Transferred Data from CATS II for Feedback in cProjects

fixed-value.description: Assignment of personnel costs to the master cost center
Assignment of personnel costs to the receiver object
Assignment of personnel costs to sender cost center
Pers. cost assgmt to sender; acct assgmt to activity type
Activity allocation between master and sender cost center
Acty alloc. master and sender; acct assgmt to activity type

dataelem.name: CABA_NOBRKS
dataelem.description: No deduction of breaks when calculating hours

documentation.definition: Specifies whether the working times recorded in the Cross-Application Time Sheet are to be leveled and whether any missing hour or clock time data is to be determined. This switch is relevant only if you use SAP HR.
documentation.use: You can use this switch to ensure that times entered in the Cross-Application Time Sheet are structured for HR Time Management with as few errors as possible. In addition, SAP R/3 evaluates the switch regardless of whether the time sheet data records possess an HR working time attribute (attendance/absence type) or not. This means that you can use the information from the work schedule even if the information is to be used only for cost accounting, for example, and is not to be transferred to HR. Depending on how the switch is set, SAP R/3 determines any missing clock times or hours and alerts users to incorrect entries. <ZH>Switch is not activated</> If you do not activate the switch, the recorded working times are compared with the information from the work schedule. SAP R/3 determines if any of the following values are missing: Number of hours (taking account of breaks) Start and end time Previous-day indicator (only if attendance/absence type was entered) Whole-day indicator (only if attendance absence type was entered) <ZH>Switch is activated</> If you activate the switch, information from the work schedule is not taken into account. SAP R/3 determines any missing values as follows: If the data record was entered with an attendance/absence type, SAP R/3 determines only the number of hours from the start and end times. If the data record was entered without an attendance/absence type, SAP R/3 calculates the number of hours and any missing start or end times by simple subtraction or addition.

dataelem.name: NO_ADD_UP
dataelem.description: Time not added up; bonus wage type

dataelem.name: QUANTITY_OR_AMOUNT
dataelem.description: Multi-purpose field for amount or quantity

tables.name: CHECK_RECORDS
tables.description: Communication Structure for HR Check and Enrich

documentation.meaning: For information about the individual fields, see the data element documentation.

INCLUDE BAPI_TABLE Table with messages from record processing. For information about the meaning of the message types, see the relevant data element documentation. See also: <DS:DE.BAPI_MTYPE>Message type</>.

documentation.functionality: This method checks the following recorded time data for accuracy: Time data for the <ZK>Absences</> (2001) and <ZK>Attendances</> (2002) infotypes. Data for the <ZK>Employee Remuneration Information</> (2010) infotype.
documentation.additional_hints: You do not have to execute this method. You can execute the method before data is transferred to the HR system. Correct data records are transferred to the HR system and stored in the following interface tables: Attendances/Absences: PTEX2000 and PTEXDIR Employee Remuneration Information: PTEX2010 and PTEXDIR Incorrect data records are not transferred to the HR system. They are logged in the Time Sheet where users can correct the data. This method also checks information about different payments. It does not checks information about cost assignments or activity allocation.
documentation.further_sources_of_inf: This method calls the following BAPIs in the HR system. These BAPIs check data recorded in the HR system. BAPI_PTMGREXTREMSPEC_CHECK BAPI_PTMGREXTATTABS_CHECK

importing.name: NO_BREAK_DEDUCTION
importing.description: No deduction of breaks when calculating hours

documentation.meaning: This parameter is relevant only if you implement HR. Depending on your setting in the <DS:DE.CABA_NOBRKS>Hours/Times from HR</> field, the following values are calculated or added to using the data in the employee's work schedule: Number of hours Start or end time Previous day indicator All-day indicator Calculation takes place independently of whether or not the data record has a HR working time attribute.

tables.name: ENRICH_RECORDS_IN
tables.description: Communication Structure for HR Check and Enrich

documentation.meaning: This parameter transfers the data records to HR to be enriched.

tables.name: ENRICH_RECORDS_OUT
tables.description: Communication Structure for HR Check and Enrich

documentation.meaning: This parameter transfers the enriched data records to the Cross-Application Time Sheet.
INCLUDE BAPI_TABLE For information about the message type, see the relevant data element documentation. See also: <DS:DE.BAPI_MTYPE>Message type</>.

documentation.functionality: This method enriches the attendances/absences and employee remuneration information recorded in the cross-application time sheet by information from the HR system and returns data and messages to the time sheet. Attendances/absences If necessary, the method determines the currency of a valuation basis. Depending on your settings in Customizing, the method compares the recorded times with the employee's personal work schedule. It determines missing start and end times or the number of hours, sets the previous day and all-day indicators if necessary, and deducts breaks. Employee Remuneration Information: The method determines the currency of a valuation basis and checks whether the specified wage type is a bonus wage type. The following happens if the data record has start and end times: depending on your settings in Customizing, the method compares the data with the employee's personal work schedule, determines the number of hours, takes account of any existing breaks, and sets the previous day indicator.
documentation.further_sources_of_inf: With the help of this method, the following BAPIs, which check and change recorded data in the HR system, are called: BAPI_PTMGREXTATTABS_CHECK

function-module.name: BAPI_TIMESHEET_HR_COLL_CHECK
function-module.description: Collision Check in CATS II Against HR

importing.name: MESSAGETYPE
importing.description: Message type: S Success, E Error, W Warning, I Info, A Abort

documentation.meaning: All time data records that are to be transferred for the first time from the Time Sheet to the HR system are stored in this parameter.
This parameter contains the HR records that collide with records from the Time Sheet. In the ROW field, a link is set to the relevant row in the parameter Return.

INCLUDE BAPI_TABLE The individual rows in this parameter link to the appropriate row in the parameter CollCheckRecords. For more information about the message type, see the relevant data element documentation. See also: <DS:DE.BAPI_MTYPE>Message Type </>.

documentation.functionality: This method allows you to check whether time data records in the Time Sheet collide with time data records in the HR system. The method checks whether a data record already exists for the same period in the HR system. Records that have been recorded with clock times are checked as are records recorded for whole days. The data to be checked is stored in the parameter CollCheckRecords. Data records that collide with data records in the HR system are returned in the parameter CollidingHRRecords. If the EXTSYSTEM (logical system) and EXTAPPLICATION (external application) fields are filled, infotype records with this external key are not taken into consideration. Records for whole days or several days must be flagged with the all-day indicator (ALL_DAY_FLAG) in the parameter ExternalRecords.

function-module.name: BAPI_TIMESHEET_HR_QUOTA_CHECK
function-module.description: Quota Check in CATS II Against HR

importing.name: MESSAGETYPE
importing.description: Message type: S Success, E Error, W Warning, I Info, A Abort

documentation.meaning: For information on the message type, see the relevant data element documentation. See also: <DS:DE.BAPI_MTYPE>Message Type</>.
This import parameter transfers all relevant time data to the HR system to simulate quota deduction.
For information about the meaning of the message types, see the relevant data element documentation. See also: <DS:DE.BAPI_MTYPE>Message type</>.

documentation.functionality: This method enables you to simulate quota deductions. In this way, you can, for example, check whether the remaining quotas in the HR system are sufficient before an absence from the cross-application time sheet is updated. The actual update takes place only when the attendance or absence is updated in the HR system.
documentation.further_sources_of_inf: With the help of this method, the following BAPI, which simulates quota deduction in the HR system, is called: BAPI_PTMGREXTATTABS_CHECKQUOTA

function-module.name: BAPI_TIMESHEET_HR_DATA_TRNSFER
function-module.description: Transfer of CATS II Data to HR

tables.name: TRANSFER_RECORDS
tables.description: Transfer Structure of HR Data from CATS II to HR

documentation.meaning: For an explanation of the individual fields, see the data element documentation.
INCLUDE BAPI_TABLE For information about the message type, see the relevant data element documentation. See also: <DS:DE.BAPI_MTYPE>Message Type</>.

documentation.functionality: This method transfers time data from the Time Sheet to the HR system. Time data is stored in the HR system in the following infotypes: <ZK>Absences</> (2001) infotype <ZK>Attendances</> (2002) infotype <ZK>Employee Remuneration Information</> (2010) infotype Information about different payments and cost assignments is also supported. This method does not support activity allocation.
documentation.hints: Data records are stored in the following tables. Attendances/Absences: interface tables PTEX2000 and PTEXDIR. The transfer report then reads data from file PTEX2000 and creates data as attendances in infotype 2002 or as absences in infotype 2001. Employee Remuneration Information: Infotypes PTEX2010 and PTEXDIR. The transfer report reads data from file PTEX2010 and creates data as employee remuneration information in infotype 2010.
documentation.further_sources_of_inf: The Check LINK method allows data to be checked for accuracy before it is transferred. This method calls the following BAPIs in the HR system. These BAPIs transfer data to the HR system. BAPI_PTMGREXTREMSPEC_INSWCOST BAPI_PTMGREXTATTABS_INSWCOST

table.name: BAPI_TIMESHEET_HR_ATTRIBUTES
table.description: Communication Structure for HR Check and Enhancement

documentation.definition: The personnel number is the only feature within a client which is unique to an employee. You have to enter a personnel number before you can display and maintain an employee's master data and time data.
Contains the number of lines in the parameter in which the error message has occurred.
Internal, language-independent, measurement unit format.
documentation.use: This format is used for internal processing.
documentation.dependencies: The internal format is automatically replaced by either the external commercial (three-character) or technical (six-character) format before output to the screen.

component.name: MEAS_UNIT_ISO
component.description: ISO code for unit of measurement

documentation.definition: ISO code for measurement units. An ISO code can be assigned to several internal measurement units.
documentation.use:
The ISO code is important for EDI. It is used to convert the internal SAP measurement units into standard measurement units. Data exchange via EDI requires internal measurement units to be converted into standard measurement units. A list of the current internationally agreed ISO codes can be ordered from the UN commission responsible (WP.4 Trade Facilitation Recommendations, Recommendation 20): UN Economic Commission for Europe Information Office Palais des Nations 1211 Geneva Switzerland
phone: +4122 917 2893 fax: +4122 917 0036 e-mail: info.ece@unece.org or it can be consulted directly via internet: http://www.unece.org/trade/facil/tf_home.htm For additional information see OSS note 69063.

documentation.definition: Specifies the number of units entered for the unit of measure.
<GL:currency>Currency</> key for amounts in the system.
Currency key (standard worldwide).
documentation.what_to_do: Enter the ISO code If you do not already use the global standard currency key as the currency key If you use the EDI application. Here the ISO code is used for exchanging information.

component.name: NUMBER_OR_AMOUNT
component.description: Multi-purpose field for amount or quantity

component.name: NO_ADD_UP
component.description: Time not added up; bonus wage type

documentation.definition: This indicates that a data record is for a full workday. Its duration corresponds to the planned working hours of the employee's daily work schedule on the day in question.
Contains a code that represents different types of objects.
documentation.use: Use this field to confine an inquiry/report to a particular object type, by naming the object type that should be reported on. To do so either: Enter the appropriate code Request a list of object types and make a selection NOTE: To include ALL types of objects in your inquiry/report, leave this field blank.
documentation.example: S represents a position, Q represents a qualification, E represents a business event, and so on.

documentation.definition: Contains a unique eight-digit number that represents a specific object, such as an organizational unit, a qualification, a business event, and so on.
documentation.use: Use this field to confine an inquiry/report to selected objects, by giving the object IDs of the objects that should be included. NOTE: The system interprets your entries differently, depending on whether you are working with <LS>sequential, structural </>or <LS>combination </>reports. With sequential reports, the system reports only on the objects you request. With structural reports, the system builds a structure for each selected object, and reports on each structure. With combination reports, the fields can be interpreted sequentially or structurally. If you enter an <LS>Evaluation path </> entries are interpreted structurally. If not, they are interpreted sequentially. Select objects for reporting by naming either a: Single object in the <LS>From </>field. The report documents the specified object. Range of object IDs in the <LS>From </>and <LS>To</> fields. The report documents all objects that fall within the specified range. List of object IDs. To do so, click on the right direction arrow. A window appears where you enter a list. The report documents all objects specified. NOTE: With sequential reports, you can include ALL objects in your inquiry/report, by leaving the <LS>Object ID </>field blank. With structural reports, this is not recommended since the system builds a structure for each object in your plan and reports on them all.
documentation.example: Single object - 50000002 Range of object IDs - 50000002 to 50000030 List of object IDs - 50000002 to 50000008, 50000015 to 50000021 and 50000026 to 50000037

documentation.definition: Each form of attendance and absence is represented by an attendance/absence type, which describes the attendance or absence in more detail.
documentation.use: An employee's incapacity to work, leave, release from work, and so on can be described in more detail by a range of absence types. The system uses the absence types to determine the payment relevance of the absence and its effects on statistics and reserves, for example. Attendance types are primarily used to document employees' work, and typically describe the type of activity.
documentation.example: Inability to work: Illness with certificate (paid) Illness without certificate (unpaid) Industrial accident Accident en route to work Accident not work-related Attendances: Overtime hours Business trip Works council activity

documentation.definition: Used to make a distinction between different amounts of money or time units that are included in various ways in the calculation of employee remuneration.
documentation.use: In the R/3 System, wage types enable you to separate amounts or time units that are used for different business purposes and processed in different ways by the system during a payroll run.

documentation.definition: The overtime compensation type indicates whether the employee should receive remuneration and/or time off for working overtime.
Employees current work center for tax calculation (USA). The current work center is used to determine the appropriate tax authorities.

The main purpose of the valuation basis is to valuate time wage types. The valuation basis is only included, if The applicable wage type was not already completely valuated. Only the number field of the corresponding wage type was completed.
<GL:currency>Currency</> key for amounts in the system.
Currency key (standard worldwide).
documentation.what_to_do: Enter the ISO code If you do not already use the global standard currency key as the currency key If you use the EDI application. Here the ISO code is used for exchanging information.

documentation.definition: The extra pay indicator controls how the basis of valuation is interpreted. <LB>blank</>: The amount specified in the <LS>Valuation basis/hour </> field defines the valuation basis of the record. <LB>+</> : The valuation basis of the record is increased by the value specified in the <LS>Valuation basis/hour </> field. <LB>-</> : The valuation basis of the record is reduced by the value specified in the <LS>Valuation basis/hour </> field.
A pay scale group is a criterion used for grading job evaluation. A pay scale group is divided up into several <DS:DE.TRFST>pay scale levels</>.
A paycale wage level (short: payscale level) is a classification criterium for job evaluation within a <DS:DE.TRFGR>payscale group</>.

You can use a premium to award extra pay to employees for above-average performance or for special working conditions. The values of these premiums are defined in customizing. They can differ according to personnel subarea grouping.
documentation.examples: Bonus for hazardous or unpleasant work Bonus for above-average performance

documentation.definition: The premium indicator is used to calculate the value of the premium or bonus. The premium rate or number is then processed in payroll.
A position is assigned the characteristics and attributes of a job. Positions are assigned to organizational units and are linked one to the other.
Key uniquely identifying a <GL:cost_center>cost center</>.

component.name: ACTTYPE
component.documentation:
DEFINE &BELEG& = an "<GL:activity_type>Activity type</>"
INCLUDE 'STAMM' OBJECT DOKU ID TX LANGUAGE EN Activity types describe the activity produced by a cost center and are measured in units of time or quantity. In activity type planning, control data determines whether the activity price for evaluation of the activity type is manually set or is derived iteratively through activity price calculation.

documentation.definition: The <GL:company_code>company code</> is an organizational unit within financial accounting.

table.name: BAPI_TIMESHEET_HR_DATA_TRANSF
table.description: Transfer Structure of HR Data from CATS II to HR

documentation.definition: External (Logical) System In the SAP environment, the logical system should be identified as such by a indicator with a maximum of 10 characters. A logical system is one in which an application works with shared data. In the ALE environment, two or more logical systems communicate with each other. Settings made in the Implementation Guide (IMG) describe how the logical systems are stored.
documentation.hints: Always enter the logical system in capital letters.

documentation.definition: This 5-character identifier describes an external application that has generated the external time data. Usually this ID is an abbreviation for the product that is connected to the R/3 HR System. You can also select "EXT" if there is only one external product.
documentation.hints: Always enter the external application in capital letters.

documentation.definition: The 20-character document number represents the document number of the data record. The document number must be unique within (external) logical systems and external applications.
documentation.hints: Always enter the document number in capital letters.

documentation.definition: An activated (checked) REVERSED field, along with the existence of three indicators (external system, external application and document number) serve to cancel a data record.
This field is a customer-specific text field and can be used for additional information.

component.name: LOCKINDICATOR
component.description: Lock Indicator for HR Master Data Record

documentation.definition: Lock inficator for HR master record

The personnel number is the only feature within a client which is unique to an employee. You have to enter a personnel number before you can display and maintain an employee's master data and time data.

documentation.definition: This indicates that a data record is for a full workday. Its duration corresponds to the planned working hours of the employee's daily work schedule on the day in question.

documentation.use: Use this field to confine an inquiry/report to selected objects, by giving the object IDs of the objects that should be included. NOTE: The system interprets your entries differently, depending on whether you are working with <LS>sequential, structural </>or <LS>combination </>reports. With sequential reports, the system reports only on the objects you request. With structural reports, the system builds a structure for each selected object, and reports on each structure. With combination reports, the fields can be interpreted sequentially or structurally. If you enter an <LS>Evaluation path </> entries are interpreted structurally. If not, they are interpreted sequentially. Select objects for reporting by naming either a: Single object in the <LS>From </>field. The report documents the specified object. Range of object IDs in the <LS>From </>and <LS>To</> fields. The report documents all objects that fall within the specified range. List of object IDs. To do so, click on the right direction arrow. A window appears where you enter a list. The report documents all objects specified. NOTE: With sequential reports, you can include ALL objects in your inquiry/report, by leaving the <LS>Object ID </>field blank. With structural reports, this is not recommended since the system builds a structure for each object in your plan and reports on them all.
documentation.example: Single object - 50000002 Range of object IDs - 50000002 to 50000030 List of object IDs - 50000002 to 50000008, 50000015 to 50000021 and 50000026 to 50000037

documentation.use: An employee's incapacity to work, leave, release from work, and so on can be described in more detail by a range of absence types. The system uses the absence types to determine the payment relevance of the absence and its effects on statistics and reserves, for example. documentation.example: Inability to work: Illness with certificate (paid) Illness without certificate (unpaid) Industrial accident Accident en route to work Accident not work-related Attendances: Overtime hours Business trip Works council activity

documentation.use: In the R/3 System, wage types enable you to separate amounts or time units that are used for different business purposes and processed in different ways by the system during a payroll run.

<GL:currency>Currency</> key for amounts in the system.
Currency key (standard worldwide).
documentation.what_to_do: Enter the ISO code If you do not already use the global standard currency key as the currency key If you use the EDI application. Here the ISO code is used for exchanging information.

documentation.definition: The extra pay indicator controls how the basis of valuation is interpreted. <LB>blank</>: The amount specified in the <LS>Valuation basis/hour </> field defines the valuation basis of the record. <LB>+</> : The valuation basis of the record is increased by the value specified in the <LS>Valuation basis/hour </> field. <LB>-</> : The valuation basis of the record is reduced by the value specified in the <LS>Valuation basis/hour </> field.
A pay scale group is a criterion used for grading job evaluation. A pay scale group is divided up into several <DS:DE.TRFST>pay scale levels</>.
A paycale wage level (short: payscale level) is a classification criterium for job evaluation within a <DS:DE.TRFGR>payscale group</>.

You can use a premium to award extra pay to employees for above-average performance or for special working conditions. The values of these premiums are defined in customizing. They can differ according to personnel subarea grouping.
documentation.examples: Bonus for hazardous or unpleasant work Bonus for above-average performance

Key uniquely identifying a <GL:cost_center>cost center</>.

component.name: ACTTYPE
component.documentation:
DEFINE &BELEG& = an "<GL:activity_type>Activity type</>"
INCLUDE 'STAMM' OBJECT DOKU ID TX LANGUAGE EN Activity types describe the activity produced by a cost center and are measured in units of time or quantity. In activity type planning, control data determines whether the activity price for evaluation of the activity type is manually set or is derived iteratively through activity price calculation.

documentation.definition: The <GL:company_code>company code</> is an organizational unit within financial accounting.
Number which identifies an <GL:order>order</> within a <GL:client>client</>.
Term identifying the <GL:cost object ID>cost object ID</>.
documentation.use: Cost objects are the activity units of business whose costs are assigned based on the cost origins. The R/3 System distinguishes between the following types of cost objects: Cost objects represented by a cost object ID Cost objects represented by objects from other components, such as production orders or sales order items Cost objects in the following areas are represented by cost object IDs: Activity-Based Costing (CO-OM-ABC) In Activity-Based Costing, overhead is first assigned to cost centers and then to business processes. From there, the overhead is assigned to cost objects as process costs. Costs for Intangible Goods and Services (CO-PC-OBJ) In Costs for Intangible Goods and Services, costs can be analyzed on <DS:GLOS.general cost object>general cost objects</>. Product Cost by Period (CO-PC-OBJ) In <DS:GLOS.Product Cost by Period>Product Cost by Period</> you can create a <DS:GLOS.cost object hierarchy>cost object hierarchy</> to record actual costs that cannot be recorded at the material or order level. You can distribute the costs assigned to the <DS:GLOS.cost_object_node>nodes</> of a cost object hierarchy directly to the individual objects in the lowest cost object nodes at period-end closing (for example, <DS:GLOS.product_cost_collector>product cost collectors</>) or you can settle the costs directly from the cost object hierarchy to a price difference account. Product Cost Controlling Information System (CO-PC) You can create further cost object IDs in the Product Cost Controlling Information System for <DS:GLOS.CO product group>CO product groups</>. You can create a cost object ID for each group, and assign materials to the cost object ID. The costs of the assigned materials appear in summarized form in the information system by product group. You can use CO product groups for product drilldown reports.
documentation.dependencies: The <DS:GLOS.cost_object_type>cost object type</> determines which functions can be used with the cost object. Functions for cost object hierarchies are performed on the assumption that the given cost object indicates the top node of the hierarchy.

documentation.definition: Key identifying a <DS:GLOS.35B732FE32862E9DE10000009B38F983> WBS element</>.
A network can structure an entire project or a task within a project. Numbers are used to differentiate these project structures.
documentation.use: When you specify a network, for example, when you are entering attendances, you can define that the network is debited when the sender cost center is credited.
documentation.activity: Use the possible entries pushbutton to select the network number for the required project structure.

documentation.definition: <zh>Production Planning</> Determines in which order the <DS:GLOS.operation>operations</> of a <DS:GLOS.sequence>sequence</> are carried out. <zh>Project System</> Number that identifies an activity.
Uniquely identifies a <DS:GLOS.3526C72DAFAB52B9E10000009B38F974>sales order</>.
Uniquely identifies an item within a <DS:GLOS.3526C72DAFAB52B9E10000009B38F974>sales order</>.
Key uniquely identifying a <DS:GLOS.3526B66EAFAB52B9E10000009B38F974>business process</>.
Germany only.
The service category is a subdivision of the <DS:DE.DART>service type</>.
Key which uniquely identifies the fund. If you assign the budget to a fund, you can obtain a detailed list of origin for the amounts involved.

component.name: FUNC_AREA
component.documentation:
Documentation created from the FKBER and FM_AREA data elements.
Structure criteria for an enterprise or government with functional aspects. Use for Cost-of-Sales Accounting The functional area is required to create a profit and loss account in Financial Accounting using <DS:GLOS.36A4B54697B32066E10000009B38F985>cost-of-sales accounting.</> The following are examples of structure criteria: Manufacture Administration Sales Research and development Use for Government The functional area is needed for Funds Management to meet legal requirements for reporting with functional aspects. You can use the functional area to represent the global targets and goals (for example, public safety, town development etc.), in particular the expenses of your organization.
<ZH>Use in cost-of-sales accounting</>
Read the documentation on <DS:TX.ACC_COS_PRERE_FAREA_MAST_DAT>Filling the Functional Area Field. </> For comprehensive information on cost-of-sales accounting and on the functional area, see the SAP Library under <LS>Accounting -> Financial Accounting -> General Ledger -> Cost-of-Sales Accounting.</> <ZH>Use in government</>
For more information on the functional area, see the implementation Guide for <LS>Funds Management Government</> in the section <LS>Activate Account Assignment Elements.</>

documentation.definition: Contains financial conditions and legal rules that were agreed upon by the sponsor and a grantee.
documentation.use: The aim of the grant is to sponsor a public project, whereby the sponsor does not intend to play an active role. A grant can be made for any purpose. It can cover the costs of an entire project, or just part of a project. You specify a grant type for every grant you create in Grant Management (GM). The grant has a limited life cycle, which is split into phases. Each phase is indicated by a system status in GM. The system statuses are as follows: First Version The initial phase, in which you can edit the grant without restrictions. Proposal The proposal is the complete formal document generated from the first version. Application If the proposal is sent to the sponsor for approval, an application is generated. The application contains, for example, budget changes, and other modifications. Award If the sponsor approves the grant, an award is generated. This is the operative phase of the grant. The budget is drawn up and assigned in this phase, which also constitutes the legally binding contract between the sponsor and the grantee. Conclusion If an award is about to expire, then it is in the conclusion phase. There are restrictions on modifying the grant in this phase. Final Conclusion The grant has expired and been closed. It can be archived, but no other actions are allowed. Terminated The grant or the grant procedure was terminated either because of internal reasons of because the sponsor rejected the application. In the Customizing of budgeting, it is possible to define different budget phases and budget versions parallel to the grant procedure. SAP delivers the following three phases: Proposal (for first draft and proposal) Application for application These budget phases can be assigned to budget versions.

table.name: BAPI_TIMESHEET_HR_PARAMETERS
table.description: Parameters for HR BAPIs in CATS II

documentation.definition: System in which applications run integrated on a shared data basis. The distribution of data between systems requires that each system in the network has a unique identification. The logical system is used for this purpose. In the SAP System the client corresponds to a logical system. You can assign a logical system to a client in the <DS:TRAS.SCC4>client maintenance</> (choose Goto -> Detail). The logical system is relevant in the following SAP areas: <GL:Application Link Enabling>ALE</> general: two or more logical systems communicate with one another. ALE - <GL:business process>ALE business processes</> (for example, cost center accounting): definition of a system where a specific application runs. Changes to master data can only be made in this system, for example. Workflow objects: the logical system in which the object is located is always included in an object's key. When maintaining the logical system, note the following: The logical system must be unique company-wide. It must not be used by any other system in the ALE integrated group. In a production system, the logical system must not be changed. If the logical system of a document reference is not set to initial and does not match your own, the system assumes the document is located in a different system.

This 5-character identifier describes an external application that has generated the external time data. Usually this ID is an abbreviation for the product that is connected to the R/3 HR System. You can also select "EXT" if there is only one external product.
documentation.hints: Always enter the external application in capital letters.

component.name: MESSAGETYPE
component.description: Message type: S Success, E Error, W Warning, I Info, A Abort

documentation.definition: This parameter has the following values: "S" for success messages "E" for error messages "W" for warnings "I" for information messages Depending on the how a BAPI is implemented, if there is a termination message, a rollback can be executed in the database. All database changes since the last commit work command are cancelled. For further information see the documentation for the BAPI in question.

component.name: NO_BREAK_DEDUCTION
component.description: No deduction of breaks when calculating hours

documentation.definition: Specifies whether the working times recorded in the Cross-Application Time Sheet are to be leveled and whether any missing hour or clock time data is to be determined. This switch is relevant only if you use SAP HR.
documentation.use: You can use this switch to ensure that times entered in the Cross-Application Time Sheet are structured for HR Time Management with as few errors as possible. In addition, SAP R/3 evaluates the switch regardless of whether the time sheet data records possess an HR working time attribute (attendance/absence type) or not. This means that you can use the information from the work schedule even if the information is to be used only for cost accounting, for example, and is not to be transferred to HR. Depending on how the switch is set, SAP R/3 determines any missing clock times or hours and alerts users to incorrect entries. <ZH>Switch is not activated</> If you do not activate the switch, the recorded working times are compared with the information from the work schedule. SAP R/3 determines if any of the following values are missing: Number of hours (taking account of breaks) Start and end time Previous-day indicator (only if attendance/absence type was entered) Whole-day indicator (only if attendance absence type was entered) <ZH>Switch is activated</> If you activate the switch, information from the work schedule is not taken into account. SAP R/3 determines any missing values as follows: If the data record was entered with an attendance/absence type, SAP R/3 determines only the number of hours from the start and end times. If the data record was entered without an attendance/absence type, SAP R/3 calculates the number of hours and any missing start or end times by simple subtraction or addition.

function-module.name: BAPI_TSLOCONNEC_TRANSFER_PS
function-module.description: Transfer of CATS II Data into PS, PM, and CO

tables.name: TRANSFER
tables.description: Transfer of CATS Data to Target Component

documentation.functionality: The TransferPS method enables you to transfer data to the interface table for the SAP R/3 application PS. You can transfer confirmation records and cancellation records. Confirmation records have the status 30, whilst cancellation records have the status 60.
documentation.hints: Note the following: Records to be transferred must be complete. That is, they must contain all the necessary information for the PS confirmation. The records you want to transfer must be checked before they are transferred to PS. In the TransferPS method, no checks are performed. In Plug-In 2003.1, the function modules CABA_LOCO_ENRICH and CABA_LOCO_CHECK are available for checking and supplementing records. To update documents after the transfer, run report RCATSTPS in the SAP R/3 system (transaction CAT5). Data that belongs to a data record are identified by the counter in the ITEMNO field. All data with the same number belongs to one record.

function-module.name: BAPI_TSLOCONNEC_TRANSFER_CO
function-module.description: Transfer of CATS II Data into PS, PM, and CO

tables.name: TRANSFER
tables.description: Transfer of CATS Data to Target Component

documentation.functionality: The TransferCO method allows you to transfer data that you entered in CATS II to the SAP R/3 application CO. You can transfer confirmation records and cancellation records. Confirmation records have the status 30, whilst cancellation records have status 60.
documentation.hints: Note the following: Records to be transferred must be complete. That is, they must contain all the necessary information required for posting to CO. The records you want to transfer must be checked before they are transferred to PM. No checks are performed in the TransferPM method. In Plug-In 2003.1, the function modules CABA_LOCO_ENRICH and CABA_LOCO_CHECK are available for checking and supplementing records. To update the documents after the transfer, run report RCATSTCO in the SAP R/3 system (transaction CAT7). Data that belongs to a data record is identified by the counter in the ITEMNO field. Data with the same number belongs to one record.

function-module.name: BAPI_TSLOCONNEC_TRANSFER_PM
function-module.description: Transfer of CATS II Data into PS, PM, and CO

tables.name: TRANSFER
tables.description: Transfer of CATS Data to Target Component

documentation.functionality: The TransferPM method enables you to transfer data that you entered in CATS II to the interface table for the SAP R/3 application PM. You can transfer confirmation records and cancellation records. Confirmation records have the status 30, whilst cancellation records have the status 60.
documentation.hints: Note the following: Records to be transferred must be complete. That is, they must contain all the necessary information required for the PM confirmation. The records you want to transfer must be checked before they are transferred to PM. No checks are performed in the TransferPM method. In Plug-In 2003.1, the function modules CABA_LOCO_ENRICH and CABA_LOCO_CHECK are available for checking and supplementing records. To update the documents after the transfer, run report RCATSTPM in the SAP R/3 system (transaction CAT9). Data that belongs to one record is identified by the counter in the ITEMNO field. All data with the same number belongs to one record.

component.name: LSTAR
component.documentation:
DEFINE &BELEG& = an "<GL:activity_type>Activity type</>"
INCLUDE 'STAMM' OBJECT DOKU ID TX LANGUAGE EN Activity types describe the activity produced by a cost center and are measured in units of time or quantity. In activity type planning, control data determines whether the activity price for evaluation of the activity type is manually set or is derived iteratively through activity price calculation.

Determines in which order the <DS:GLOS.sub-operation>sub-operations</> of an <DS:GLOS.operation>operation</> are listed.
ID of capacity requirements record
Key which describes <GL:capacity>capacity</> in more detail. The capacity category enables you to determine whether it is machine or labor capacity.
documentation.use: You can allocate capacities of different capacity categories to a <GL:work_center>work center</>.

documentation.definition: Key identifying the <GL:work_center>work center</>.
Key identifying a <DS:GLOS.35B732FE32862E9DE10000009B38F983> WBS element</>.
Contains a unique eight-digit numerical code, that represents a specific object (for example, an organizational unit, qualification or business event).
documentation.use: When you work with infotype records, this field allows you to use the Fast entry feature. Fast entry enables you to create numerous infotype records without having to exit and re-enter the infotype window. To select the object that the infotype record should belong to, either: Enter the object's eight-digit code Use the matchcode feature to search for the object

documentation.definition: Key uniquely identifying a <DS:GLOS.plant>plant</>.

documentation.definition: Earliest start / date
Latest start / date
Earliest end / date
Latest end / date
Remaining capacity requirements for operation segment "Processing"

Determines the distribution of capacity requirements for an operation over the periods of the operation duration for the following orders: <DS:GLOS.network>networks</> (internal activities) <DS:GLOS.process order>process orders</> <GL:maintenance order>maintenance orders</> The capacity requirements of an operation for these orders are not derived from the operation segments.
documentation.use: The distribution is used when the data is displayed by period, for instance in capacity evaluation and in the tabellar planning board of capacity levelling. &use& in networks In network activities, you use the distribution key to distribute capacity requirements and plan costs over the periods.

documentation.definition: The <GL:order_category>order category</> determines the technical properties of orders. You need to assign each <GL:order_type>order type</> to an order category, which can have more than one order type.
documentation.description: Orders have different purposes in the R/3 System. The structure and function of an order, as well as the transactions you use to process it, all depend on the order category.

documentation.use: A factory calendar distinguishes between working days and non-working days.
documentation.dependencies: If you have entered an exception rule for non-working days and have selected <LS>factory calendar</>, you must enter a factory calendar that is relevant to your company.

documentation.definition: Key identifying a <DS:GLOS.35B732FE32862E9DE10000009B38F983> WBS element</>.
User-definable text, 40 characters long.
User-definable text, 40 characters long.
The selection column allows you to select an entire line and copy or release the data contained in the line, for example.
The selection column allows you to select an entire line and copy or release the data contained in the line, for example.

documentation.definition: The personnel number is the only feature within a client which is unique to an employee. You have to enter a personnel number before you can display and maintain an employee's master data and time data.
